errors.error_description: The Python version requirement is specified as 'Python 3.8+', which is too broad and may lead to using an untested or incompatible future Python version.
The command 'pip install --edit donation-tracker' is incorrect. The '--edit' flag is not a valid option for pip install.
The commands to install and clone the repository are in the wrong order. 'pip install -e donation-tracker' attempts to install from a local directory that has not been created yet by 'git clone'.
correction_candidates: First run `git clone git@github.com:GamesDoneQuick/donation-tracker`, then `pip install -e donation-tracker`.
Run `pip install git+https://github.com/GamesDoneQuick/donation-tracker.git@master` instead of cloning and installing locally.
Run `git clone git@github.com:GamesDoneQuick/donation-tracker` and then `python setup.py install` inside the new directory.
Run `pip install -e ./donation-tracker` after cloning the repository.
errors.golden_answer: First run `git clone git@github.com:GamesDoneQuick/donation-tracker`, then `pip install -e donation-tracker`.

errors.error_description: The command 'pip install django' does not specify a version, which can lead to installing a future version of Django that is incompatible with the project.
